code: import _classCallCheck from"/home/awsh/scott-shaw.github.io/node_modules/@babel/runtime/helpers/esm/classCallCheck.js";import _createClass from"/home/awsh/scott-shaw.github.io/node_modules/@babel/runtime/helpers/esm/createClass.js";import _inherits from"/home/awsh/scott-shaw.github.io/node_modules/@babel/runtime/helpers/esm/inherits.js";import _createSuper from"/home/awsh/scott-shaw.github.io/node_modules/@babel/runtime/helpers/esm/createSuper.js";import React from"react";import"../style/research.css";import paper from"../assets/files/CDC2022-kuramotoCPG.pdf";import{jsx as _jsx}from"react/jsx-runtime";import{jsxs as _jsxs}from"react/jsx-runtime";var Research=/*#__PURE__*/function(_React$Component){_inherits(Research,_React$Component);var _super=_createSuper(Research);function Research(){var _this;_classCallCheck(this,Research);_this=_super.call(this);_this.state={};return _this;}_createClass(Research,[{key:"componentDidMount",value:function componentDidMount(){document.title="Scott Shaw: Research";}},{key:"render",value:function render(){return/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("body",{children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("section",{class:"text-center mt-3",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"container text-center",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h1",{class:"",children:"Research"})})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{class:"container marketing",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{class:"row featurette",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{class:"col-md-6",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h2",{class:"featurette-heading",children:"Keyframe-based CPG for Stable Gait Design and Online Transitions in Legged Robots"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("p",{class:"featurette-description",children:"While animals easily and seamlessly transition between gaits to overcome challenging environments, current methods to design stable gait transitions often rely on computationally expensive optimization. In this work, we introduce a central pattern generator (CPG) model that allows intuitive gaitdefinition and online, real-time gait transitions while ensuring stability and forward progression. Specifically, we propose to rely on keyframes \u2013 discrete key leg configurations that can be sequenced into a gait \u2013 to define arbitrary legged gaits. We introduce a new task-space CPG, which relies on the well-known Kuramoto model and a new feedforward term to ensure synchronized convergence to these keyframes. We then show how this framework can naturally be extended to allow arbitrary gait transitions by developing two stabilization techniques. First, we reason about the robot\u2019s predicted stability to disable specific oscillator updates during transition, while minimizing the resulting effect on forward locomotion. Second, we control the robot\u2019s body position within the grounded legs to ensure current and predicted stability based on inexpensive forward prediction of the CPG model. We validate our approach by presenting simulation and experimental results on a hexapod robot following and transitioning among hexapedal and quadrupedal gaits in a number of indoor and outdoor locomotion and mobile manipulation scenarios."}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("p",{children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("a",{class:"btn btn-secondary paper-buttons",href:paper,role:"button",children:"View PDF \xBB"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("a",{class:"btn btn-secondary paper-buttons",href:"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKiMICJzRdz7QOVwizHeulsRKGM7uVb7O",role:"button",children:"Video Playlist \xBB"})]})]}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"featurette-heading col-md-6",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"embed-responsive embed-responsive-16by9",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("iframe",{width:"400",height:"315",src:"https://www.youtube.com/embed/MwdPQ0rqQuk",title:"YouTube video player",frameborder:"0",allow:"accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture",allowfullscreen:true})})}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("div",{class:"featurette-description col-md-12",children:/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("p",{children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("b",{children:"Shaw, S."}),", Sartoretti, G., 2022, December.
